page.title: 12Garden Centre, Calver.
page.content: On an open site at Calver Crossroads, in the grounds of a former Boot Factory, now used only for storage, is a Garden Centre. This does not grow plants but holds stocks of container- grown plants and shrubs, fertilizer, bulbs and all types of equipment needed for making and maintaining gardens. It also sells stone troughs and pots, to match the local stone. The garden centre is open every day and has a spacious car park which is often full at weekends, with cars parked on both sides of the road as well. It attracts people from a wide area and provides work for local women in the shop.
